title: 1 killed, 3 hurt in shooting outside house party
content:
LAS VEGAS (FOX5) -
The four victims of a deadly shooting in a northwest Las Vegas neighborhood were leaving a house party when a someone in a vehicle pulled up next to them and opened fire, according to police.
Las Vegas Metro police said they received a call of a shooting about 5 a.m. Sunday in the 3400 block of Rancho Drive.
Officers found four people suffering apparent gunshot wounds. Three of the victims were transported and treated at University Medical Center while the fourth was pronounced deceased at the scene, according to police.
Citing investigators, police said the victims were at a house party in the 3300 block of Corona Del Mar when they got into some sort of a verbal altercation.
After leaving the party a white, four-door sedan drove up next to them and the passenger fired a handgun into the victim vehicle, striking four people before fleeing.
Police are not sure if the suspects involved in the shooting are the same subjects involved in the confrontation at the party.
As of this incident, Metro has investigated 72 homicides this year.
Police urge people with information on the case to contact Metro's Homicide Section at 702-828-3521 or at homicide@lvmpd.com. People can also send tips to Crime Stoppers at 702-385-5555 or at www.crimestoppersofnv.com.
